2W0181








[solution]		 _____ 2W0182








[solution]      [Next]
2W0183








[solution]		 _____ 2W0184








[solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0181
    • 1. Rg4!! now the queen is
    • threatened and so is Qxg7
    • mate on move 2.

    		_____
  • 2W0182
    • 1. Bg4 and black is not going to be
    • able to avoid 2. Qf3 winning the
    • knight

  • 2W0183
    • 1. Re1 pins the knight to the king.
    • If 1. ... f6 2.
    • f4 wins the knight

    		_____
  • 2W0184
    • 1. Qc6+ Kb8
    • (If Kd8 2. Bg5 mate!)
    • 2. Qb7++

    2W0185








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0186








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0187








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0188








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0185
    • never mind Qxh6+. Instead 1. Qe7+
    • Kg6 and now either 2. f5 mate or 2.
    • Re6 mate.

    		_____
  • 2W0186
    • 1. axb5 wins at least a pawn. If
    • 1. ... cxb5 2.
    • Qf3 wins the rook on a8.

  • 2W0187
    • 1. Qh3+ kg7 (Black can play Bh4
    • but it makes no
    • difference) 2. Qh6 mate.

    		_____
  • 2W0188
    • 1. Rb4+ and now 1. ... Qc4 gives up
    • the Queen or 1.
    • ... Kxd5 2. Qxd6 mate!

    2W0189








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0190








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0191








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0192








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0189
    • 1. c6 and the bishop can't move to
    • f5 because or c8
    • because of 2. Re8 mate.

    		_____
  • 2W0190
    • 1. Qe2 Kf6 (if Kd6 then Qe5 mate)
    • 2. Bg5+ skewers the
    • king and wins the queen

  • 2W0191
    • 1. Nxf6+ Kf8 2. Nd7+ forks the
    • King and Rook. Or 1.
    • .... Kh8 2. Rxh7 mate

    		_____
  • 2W0192
    • 1. d7 and white is going to Queen a
    • pawn. 1. ...
    • Rxc6 2. dxe8=Q wins a rook

    2W0193








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0194








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0195








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0196








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0193
    • Cute is 1. c8=N+ but just as good
    • if not better is 1. c8=Q Bxc8 2.
    • Nxc8+ with a fork

    		_____
  • 2W0194
    • 1. Nxf6+ and 2. Qh7 mate. Also 1.
    • exf6 works because it threatens
    • mate on g7 as well.

  • 2W0195
    • Thanks to kabal for showming me 1.
    • Qb8+ Ka5 2. b4+
    • forking the king and queen.

    		_____
  • 2W0196
    • 1. Rxc8+ Rxc8 2. Qxf5+ forks the
    • king and rook and
    • it gives white a nice position

    2W0197








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0198








    [solution]      [Next]
    2W0199








    [solution]    		 _____ 2W0200








    [solution]      [Next]
  • 2W0197
    • 1. Na7 and the attacked rook must
    • stay in place or
    • lose the knight on c5 on move
    • 2.

    		_____
  • 2W0198
    • 1. Nf6+!! with the threat of 2.
    • Qxf7 mate. Black must give up his
    • queen to stop the mate.

  • 2W0199
    • 1. Qg3+ Qg5 2. Qxg5 mate.
    • Submitted by Reddtrain on
    • the Free Internet Chess Server.

    		_____
  • 2W0200
    • In a bullet game, a 1692 player
    • fell victim to either 1. Re8+ or
    • Qe8+ that mates on move 2.
